channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Car trouble: Can the French car industry recover to pre-pandemic levels?
item.description: Sales are down, factories are closing—but profits remain high. As EVs, offshoring, and China reshape the road ahead, France’s car sector faces a recko...

item.title: Good news for night owls: When you need sleep is determined not by laziness, but chronotype. Here’s what that means
item.description: When you need sleep depends on what’s called your chronotype—your body’s natural inclination towards certain times of day.

item.title: Stripe’s billionaire Collison brothers say remote work solves the ‘two-body problem’ faced by working couples
item.description: Stripe president John Collison cautioned against RTO mandates, saying they catered to the “bottom 5% of the company.”

item.title: Half of the world’s cars won’t be fully electric by 2040—Renault and Geely are betting big on hybrids to fill the gap
item.description: Horse Powertrain’s modular hybrid tech aims to bridge the global EV gap—and help automakers scale clean mobility faster across diverse markets.

item.title: Opinion: Market cheers the U.S.-China trade deal, but the tariff damage is done
Trump is hosting a dinner for the biggest buyers of his memecoin. The guest list is now set—and many of the winners are foreign nationals
item.description: Democratic lawmakers have said the crypto confab is a clear case of corruption.

item.title: SALT deduction would triple under House proposal. Why some in GOP are unhappy.
The S&P 500 just did this for the first time in months. Why a rally may follow.
Gold skids more than 3% on tariff relief. Is it time to sell?
The wait is over: Coinbase is finally joining the S&P 500 index
